children.text: The sections of exposed yellow polyethylene gas pipe protruding out of the walls have not been shielded or protected from the sun and its ultra violet rays, and will be damaged in the event of a bushfire.
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3959 Construction of Buildings in Bushfire-Prone Areas, states that
‘Above-ground, exposed water and gas supply pipes shall be metal’ .
Additionally, Australian Standard AS 4176 Polyethylene/Aluminium and Cross-Linked Polyethylene & Aluminium Macro-Composite Pipe Systems for Pressure Applications states that

‘Polyethylene or cross-linked polyethylene macro-composite pipes which are either natural or of colours other than black are not suitable for use or extended storage where exposed to direct sunlight’ .
This gas pipe installation must be rectified to comply with the requirements of AS 3959 Construction of Buildings in Bushfire-Prone Areas.
